website_summaries.verdict: When you want a perfect patty every time, this press is the model of consistency.
pros: This model tightly presses the meat, so your burgers won’t collapse and break apart as you’re placing them on the grill
Allows you to adjust the thickness of each patty that you’re creating
If you want to create stuffed burgers, this model handles the job nicely
Create your own sausage patties or crab cakes too
cons: Costs a little more than some others
Must use wax paper for best results

customer_reviews.title: The worst product that I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: It starts with the cheapest Chinese pot metal. Almost impossible to adjust and clean. The threaded adjustments are as crude as a 16th century torture devise. There is no way to gauge the thickness of the burger other than trial and error. If you ever get the monstosity set, all adjustments will have to be redone after disassembly of this nightmare for cleaning. You must use wax paper or nothing will release. After three times using it i threw it in the garbage. I have no idea how anyone could rate this junk over a 1.
customer_reviews.author: RickMD

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETELY BROKEN AFTER 10 USES
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to press about 100 patties, once a week, for 10 weeks. So, after 1000 presses, the top handle with the adjustable screw base completely broke off from the frame of the structure. I'll either buy another and keep the broken parts in case it happens again, or try a new brand.
customer_reviews.author: r2artdesign

customer_reviews.title: A must have for burger lovers
customer_reviews.text: The Weston Burger Express Hamburger Press works very well and can adjust from quarter pound size up to three quarter pound burger four and a half inch in diameter. It can be kept clean if two wax papers are used. Using two sheets of wax paper not only keeps the burger press clean, but also wraps and seals burger patties to store in fridge to use for next meals. With burger press you can add onions, peppers, cheese, whatever to meat then make patties and freeze or put in fridge for next day or two meals. The hamburger patty paper I used is  The See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design, not practical, and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible design. Picture not accurate. The adjustable screw top does not have size measurements as depicted. You have to adjust the size through trial and error. It takes forever to clean. The press squeezes ground meat between the adjustable top and the rigid sides. In order to clean this meat out, you have to unscrew the entire top, which takes several minutes, and has multiple springs and pins to keep track of. Ridiculous. I threw this into the garbage and purchased a solid 1 piece design. That works better, is easier to clean, and was cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... three times and the metal cracked which makes it useless (see picture)
customer_reviews.text: Used three times and the metal cracked which makes it useless (see picture). Spend your money on another hamburger press that you can't break with your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Perfect Patty!
customer_reviews.text: This press is pretty self explanatory. Very solid construction. If you loosen the top thickness control screw too much, it will pop out without warning. Would be nice if they could design some kind of thickness indicator into the adjustment mechanism. Took a slight amount of practice to figure it out. It doesn't work very well if you overload it, but you'll quickly figure out how much meat to use based on trial and error. My only complaint is that you can't put it in the dishwasher. I hate washing things by hand. I suppose it would be easier to clean if I used waxed paper or parchment like they show in the picture. This was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy and makes perfect burgers
customer_reviews.text: This burger press is wonderful. Would suggest using plastic wrap and wax paper when using the press. Wax paper on the bottom and plastic wrap on the top, making it much easier to pull burger out of the press. Plastic wrap also makes sure that meat does not get stuck inside of the press, ensuring a perfect press and easy cleanup
customer_reviews.author: carrcrash

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: The initial looks and experience thought that it was good and durable. There is a serious design issue with the press plates though. The press plates have an irregular surface so when you press the patty it creates vacuum points and when you try to remove it the patty tears apart. If you use this you will have to use with paper or you won't be able to get your patties off the press plates without destroying them. Giving it 2 stars though because the all metal design is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Potter

customer_reviews.title: It needs alot of efforts to clean it
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the products that I regret purchasing from amazon driven by the high number of 5 star reviews , the machine is clingy and not easy to clean, you have to tear it apart in order to be able to clean it fully, the efficiency of making the burgers is not goods, especially when you know that the patty sometimes gets stuck !! There is a lot of cheap plastic tools that can do the job without any hussle, I don't really recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Husam A.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS. IT IS NOT RETURNABLE AND IS DEFECTIVE.
customer_reviews.text: Immediately got a metal sliver when I took this item out of the box. I do not want an item that is so sharp it cannot be touched. I tried to return the item the same day I got it, because I immediately re boxed it after digging the metal out of my finger. A message popped up and said this item cannot be returned. THAT IS RIDICULOUS. It is defective. I spent almost $20 on something that is hazardous to touch. So DISAPPOINTED!
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Great to use.
customer_reviews.text: This press has been especially great for making thin patties and then sandwiching veggies and cheese between then putting back in the press. They worked great on the grill, and if you want thick patties this is the press to have. I've done both and it works very well. It is even better if you buy the wax paper inserts and put then on the plates of the press before making the patties. It is a little time consuming to take apart and clean but it is better with the wax paper sheets. It makes clean up a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: JimInTexas

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this press. No Return Policy
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product was terrible. Had to use by Steel Brush to clean the shaft and threads. It did not work at all on arrival. The threads on the shaft were damaged either by poor quality manufacturing work or poor assembly work. Be sure you are aware that this product has a NO RETURN Policy. If you are really set on purchasing this brand of a burger press, I would highly recommend the Press with Ejector (spring).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate photos
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate pictures and description. The item I received does NOT have thickness indicators engraved on the thickness adjustment shaft such as 1/2” or 1/4” as pictured. Very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Bad Design
customer_reviews.text: Making burgers by hand is not hard, but a good press can really speed the process up when you need to make a lot. This press is solidly built but is is pretty useless for making burgers quickly because the patties stick inside it. I was able to get them out in one piece but it was time consuming. By patty number four I ended up tossing it in the trash and making the rest by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Grundman

customer_reviews.title: No measurement markings on stem like photos
customer_reviews.text: Photos don’t match the ones in description. There are no measurement markings on stem so you have to adjust for first few burgers to get desired thickness. Waste time and burgers. Little bit of a disappointment considering that was one of the reasons I chose this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith III

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It takes a few tries to set the size to where you want it and you can't lock it in place. This product is great if you buy your ground beef in bulk and you want to make your own patties. I actually use a kitchen scale to measure out all the meat so the burgers are all the same size. Once you do this you can make 4 dozen patties in about 15 minutes. Freeze them and you're done.
customer_reviews.author: Sagacity

customer_reviews.title: No return policy
customer_reviews.text: This company doesn’t not have a return policy! In my opinion there is a good reason, because this product is a piece of junk. You have to turn wing screw type to adjust the thickness of the meat. The wing screw is extremely difficult to turn. Additional, I couldn’t find how you remove the top plate to clean after use, creating concern about health sanitation.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t what I expected. Took a lot of force to pack the hamburger patties that wouldn’t fall apart at this point the meat is stuck in the press. Went back to weighing the meat out and press by hand with wax paper to make uniform patties. Heavy construction, solid operation just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I grind most of my burger meat myself and use a coarse grind. Don't keep messing with the meat just make a ball, flatten a little then put in the press and you have nice juicy burgers. If you pack it too much and smash the patties before you put in the press it seems to make them tougher/ dryer. I scoop out about a 1/3 cup per burger or 1/2 cup for a little thicker patty. Spray measuring cup with a little oil spray and when you take it out of the cup it is already flat on both ends. Also get the patty wax paper with it, You'll thank me later
customer_reviews.author: Kgrem

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This product does not have the feel of a quality product. Parts are loose fitting and have too much play. When I first used it, ground beef was found above the adjustable presser when I cleaned it. There was no. When the Hamburger maker arrived, there was no helpful pamphlet to help you with experience. ,like how to keep ground meat from sticking to this hamburger maker or even recipes.
customer_reviews.author: agsb

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the price, if you make a lot of Hamburgers you need this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the wax papers. I would tell you that if you buy this you need the wax papers. I would not use without. The wax papers make everything super simple in the process, as far as cleaning. removing patties from the mechanism and getting the patties on the grill. I never used this without the wax papers but for the minimal cost of the wax papers I cannot imagine not using them. Highly recommend using this and the price I thought was great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Trish Evans

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is every kitchens nightmare. I used mine and instantly threw it in the trash. It’s bulky, very annoying to clean, it makes uneven patties, it’s hard to clean, it’s hard to open once it’s squished your patty to uneven oblivion. Oh did I mention, it’s hard to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: This high quality tool makes burger making so easy. The meat cooks evenly so you have bun sized burgers. My wife likes thin and I like a thicker burger....with a few twists, you can go from one to the other. Portion size can be controlled as well... Buy the wax paper it will save you time and makes freezing or prepping for the grill much much easier. Just buy it
customer_reviews.author: Danny C

customer_reviews.title: Consistent patties
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product 08/19 and was pleasently surprised with the ease of use. This product comes with easy to understand instructions along with recommended cleaning and food safety. You get consistent sized patties in many desired weights. I would highly recommend buying 6" waxed paper pieces so that the raw hamburger meat never touched the press and then can be used to separate the patties for refrigerator or freezing. If you buy it....you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: scott terrien

customer_reviews.title: Really nice to have
customer_reviews.text: We grind our own burger, and make a lot of hamburgers for our family - this forms a nice uniform burger, in whatever thickness you like, so they cook perfectly on the grill. If you grill, and like burgers, buy this and some individual pre-cut wax paper sheets and you will be a happy camper all grilling season long. (In Texas that's from January to December, with maybe one week off for inclement weather, lol) Its also a snap to clean, and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: presented it to him and that evening got raving praise on how perfect everything looked and worked out
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to a Taiwanese Friend living in Malaysia who was confounded on how to make patties "Like McDonalds", presented it to him and that evening got raving praise on how perfect everything looked and worked out. Revealed to him he could use it on breakfast sausage to make patties as well, and it blew his mind. I have a double-press for my use at home, figured this was a good bet for him and I was right.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Dighera

customer_reviews.title: The pictures for this product are a joke! No size of patty thickness on mine!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the one with the spring so that it has the ejecting action. However, on this one there is NO SIZES on the handle as pictured in the advertisement. Therefore, after cleaning, it is impossible to put back together so that you have it set at the same size (thickness) of the patty's that you just made. Had I known this (false advertising) I would have purchased the one without the ejecting spring action as this is not necessary anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Chauvin

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, great little press
customer_reviews.text: I love this press! It is very easy to use and produces consistent results. I did purchase a box of burger papers and use them when pressing which allows me to lift out the burger and stack the, without sticking. The burgers are also a good size. We love making portobello buns since we don't eat grain at all and have used this press with grass fed/finished ground beef and bison with great results. Clean-up was easy and this unit is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Not A Robot

customer_reviews.title: Hated this item
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this unit. It is sturdy but isn't east to use. Horrible to clean. Ended up tossing it out and buying a cheap plastic one that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Uniform patties all the time!
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time for hamburgers and for sausage patties! When paired with wax paper sheets it is absolutely perfect. The wax paper makes it way easier to remove the patty and then carry it to the pan or grill. The dissassembley is way easy also. Unthread the top handle and the patty press is removed along with the spring, unthread the adjuster nut, and wash it with all your other dishes. It's great! I would highly recommend this product! I usually use my at least twice a week!
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Variable Size Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Once you decide on a size, the locking nut holds it. I would recommend using some kind of paper sheet. I useand am satisfied with them. I especially like how the press will handle overflow - you don't have to guess the exact amount of chopped meat to put in each time. Clean-up is easy.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hampel

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: So we made potato patties and we didn't adjust the plunger so some came out the sides. First time using. Will be making other patties and I still think this is better than the plastic one we had.
customer_reviews.author: KLJ

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried any others, but this one works perfect. I used the tip of putting plastic wrap on the top so the meat doesn't touch the machine. It's very easy to adjust for the amount of meat being pressed, easy to clean and really easy to use. I'd highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie

customer_reviews.title: Good Press
customer_reviews.text: There are a number of knock-offs of this patty press, do some YouTube reviews to make sure you get the variant you want. I didn’t, fortunately, I lucked out and bought the one I would have wanted. I make 5oz burger and 4oz sausage patties. Be sure to use 6”X6” wax paper patty wrappers. It will take a few tries at figuring this thing out to make your patties the way you want them. Upper body strength is a plus when using this press.
customer_reviews.author: Joel D. Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Stupid and complicated.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a good idea but is more trouble than it is worth. Pain in the ass to clean. Cannot adjust to make thin patties. Better off with a simple hand held press.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfectly shaped burgers every time.
customer_reviews.text: This convenient to use burger form makes perfectly shaped burgers every time. i love that the burger height is adjustable, letting me choose my preferred thickness. I recommend using wax paper squares both on top and beneath the burger while using the press. It makes both cleanup and working with the patties much easier. The workmanship on the press is excellent and sturdy. It will last for many many years.
customer_reviews.author: M. Santos

customer_reviews.title: Best Burgers
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of strength in my hands anymore (getting old is not for sissies). This thing is fabulous. My burgers no longer fall apart. For people who like shortcuts - do not skip the papers. They make it work. If you don't use them, the meat gets all up inside the upper mechanism; and your burgers don't turn out correctly. All-in-all, it's a great product. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AnonAmiss

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Burger Press
customer_reviews.text: This press is perfect if you adhere to the following protocol: Product (meat or vegetable mix) should be chilled[not frozen], spray both surfaces with non-stick spray or use wax paper, test the size of your "ball" with the desired thickness[it's almost full-proof if you weigh each ball] , press down the lid first, then press on the button, lift the top, remove product and you're ready for the next patty. All of that should take less than 10 seconds. Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Zbigjeff

customer_reviews.title: Simple but great
customer_reviews.text: My son wants ROUND patties. This little gadget does the trick cheaply and easily. Nothing fancy - I put an ice-cream dipper full of ground beef between two waxed paper squares (from Amazon, too) , press once, turn it over, press once and VOILA! A perfect round patty at the exact thickness you want. I have very little upper body strength but I can do this. It's great having a plastic container filled with patties ready anytime you want one. You need this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be mounted!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good sized burger patty. I have not mounted this unit as others have implied makes it easier to use. I just use a non skid mat (Shelf liner) to put under the press. The quality is a little to be desired and the paint is already coming off in places and the aluminum is starting to corrode in these places. I can live with this because I will simply keep the press oiled so that there is no more deterioration as it will be stored in the cabinet more than it will be used. This is a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use even harder to clean
customer_reviews.text: Total failure. How come it got good reviews ? I have no idea . The simple plastic ones are so much better, easier to use and clean . Avoid at all cost ...
customer_reviews.author: tb

customer_reviews.title: We had trouble with this.
customer_reviews.text: We received this burger maker and tried it right away. Unfortunately, we did not have good luck with it. The meat came out the sides, got stuck in the "presser" and did not make even burgers. I suppose if you make perfectly formed balls of meat and place them dead center, maybe it would be different. We did try different ways to get it to work but it was not for us. We had to return it. Hopefully others have better luck than we did.
customer_reviews.author: sandb365

customer_reviews.title: Wife laughs when i use it, but loves the burgers
customer_reviews.text: We love quarter pound burgers., I weigh out 5 ounces of meat, with press adjusted all way down, presses out great. Using papers on top and bottom, they most generally just fall out when pressed, if not the spring loaded plate pops them right out. I don't get much extra meat to clean, the 5 ounces works out just right. Its really nice to have a burger that fits the bun. 4.5 inches is just right for store bought buns.
customer_reviews.author: JLBolen

customer_reviews.title: Invest in wax paper squares
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. I weigh out my raw meat on wax paper squares, put it in the press and place a wax square on top of the meat. Close it and press the plunger, and you get the same burger every time. Super easy to take apart and clean. There is a ~2mm gap between the plunger and the inside wall of the press. Based on design on that design, it doesn’t seem like it’s meant to be used without wax paper. For the people complaining about this thing making a mess, just use wax paper.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Garofolo

customer_reviews.title: Better with an ejector!
customer_reviews.text: If you use the hamburger paper this is great. I make 10lbs at a time and freeze in packs of 12 thats 24 patties just under a half pound each. Flavored just the way my family likes.. cook one now and freezer one for later. They are a good size for hamburger buns. You do have to take it apart to clean, but I did not find that to be a problem. Invest in the paper though makes it so much easier. The ejector is the key. I bought this one and the kind you just press in. I was not sure which one I would like more. After using both, I have no use for the other.
customer_reviews.author: Ckaliszczak

customer_reviews.title: Set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.text: Very good press for the money. I have tried several and like this one by far the best. The material is vast so it is very heavy duty. The downside is it’s not that easy to take apart for cleaning. That’s not a big issue for me as I use the hamburger paper as liners. The meat never touches the metal. It took me a few tries and adjusting at first to get the right thickness vs quantity of meat. I now measure 1/2 of hamburger and place it in the press. Perfect patties each and every time with no spillout.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Casperson

customer_reviews.title: Surprised and Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was worried, when I first got this, that the burgers wouldn't fit on those regular small buns. And they fit. Actually, they fit perfectly! You can make them thin or thick depending on what you like. I put parchment paper on the bottom and over the chop meat, this way less mess! I did find that rolling the chop meat before putting it on helps the burgers hold up. If you just put chunks of chop meat down, the burgers tend to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaPeterson

customer_reviews.title: Coating started coming off after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: The press works, but the one I received had serious quality control issues. The coating started coming off from different pieces. I don't want metal coating/paint in my hamburgers. I sent it back. While it does work, it is a bit of a pain to clean. You must disassemble it and wash by hand. Amazon offered an exchange, but I ordered a different hamburger press.
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hamburgers Every Time
customer_reviews.text: I barbecue often and tried numerous patty makers, only to be disappointed. The Weston Burger Express creates a perfect burger every time. Whether a novice cook or an expert griller, this is a must have. It is easy to use and to adjust burger thickness. When finished, it is a breeze to clean. If you grill burgers, you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ira B. Korman

customer_reviews.title: Quality ok considering the low price. My unit was purchased in April 2018 and is labeled “made in China”
customer_reviews.text: The press works and does the job, but quality wise it is on the lower end. I’m aware of the low price and therefore it is good. Adjustment of the thickness is a little clumsy as the thread is from poor quality and hard to turn. I hope it will break in over time. I’ll use it until it breaks, next time I will look for better quality.....you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Technik-Guru

customer_reviews.title: Good Burger Press
customer_reviews.text: This press works just as described. Quick and easy to use. Only negative I can come up with is that it is somewhat rugged, and doesn't have that fine finished look of other appliances, which doesn't bother me one iota, but was noted by my wife. I like it. Clean up is a breeze, and it stores away open or closed as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Larry E.  Vaughn Jr

customer_reviews.title: Make the best burger ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I did not buy one of those cheap plastic devices. I love that I can make my burger as thick as I want and then all the rest will be the same size with me wasting time by measuring and redoing as I did with the plastic. For me, it was worth the extra money to buy an all-metal device that will last for years. It's made so well, you might want to list it in your will and prevent future family fights over it. It's easy to use and very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Deny

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Burger Press!
customer_reviews.text: This hamburger press is just plain awesome! I can't say enough good things about it. I have been using it for several weeks and it really does create perfect burgers. Set it to any size...thin or WOW and it just plain works. I have found that the easiest way to use it is to place a piece of wax paper on the base, then place the meat on it and press. The meat is easily ejected from the device with the spring loaded handle. Clean up is easy as the entire unit is easily disassembled. If you want a perfect burger shape, this is the press for you!
customer_reviews.author: J Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Weston Burger Express Hamburger Press
customer_reviews.text: easily make equal size & shape burgers I use Hamburger Patty Paper, 5.5" x 5.5" on both sides I mix seasonings, a few bread crumbs, egg, Worcester sauce in ground turkey or chicken & & my 8 year old grand son loves therm hes very picky he calls them granddads grand burgers The whole extended family eats all I can cook
customer_reviews.author: Handy Andy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect patties are made with love, not magic...
customer_reviews.text: ...or you could use the Weston Burger Express Hamburger Press With Patty Ejector! this makes burger patty manufacture a breeze. as other reviewers have mentioned, i highly recommend using a wax sheet on bottom and one on top; the meat never touches the press and it's a lot cleaner this way. how the burgers taste is on you but at least they'll look good.
customer_reviews.author: Habshacklenacker

customer_reviews.title: Burger Maker
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have gotten the one with the spring on it. Makes nice shaped and packed burgers but nearly impossible to get out looking the same way.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: uncleanable
customer_reviews.text: Tried to return the product after using it once and found it was designed so not allow the top part of the press (where the beef would squeeze in) to be cleaned. Became unsanitary and unuseable. Then tried to return and got the run around - every time I tried to return, all Amazon would do is ask me to continue shopping even though the item was returnable until May 31. Shame on you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: RSM

customer_reviews.title: Good press
customer_reviews.text: Other than myself, my family does not like thick hamburger patties so I purchased this product hoping to save time making consistent hamburger patties to their liking. I used this product several times and patties were consistent, but nostalgia wore off, and i find it easier to occasionally make all patties by hand, which weren't as consistent as the press (hence the 4-stars). The Weston Press is very easy to clean - to keep it from getting too messy, I placed a wax paper on each side of hamburger patty. Regardless, it would have been easy to clean. I do recommend this product if you prefer consistent patties.
customer_reviews.author: owh03

customer_reviews.title: Solid, functional, durable ~~ ☆well done!☆
customer_reviews.text: Aside from a wide, round, flat burger which I associate with fast food joints, this product works extremely well. It's a lot faster and cleaner if making burgers in production. Easy to clean, although most people would be bummed it is dishwasher safe. Excellent for veggie burgers too.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Patties Every Time
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I hope my reviews are of value to others, I depend on your reviews when making purchasing decisions. Things I do not like: Not dishwasher safe and using wax paper is a must for the patties to release easily. Things I like: Perfect burger patties every time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pokey

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a rugged, well-built product. Heavy duty construction, easy to clean. I use waxed paper sheets to keep it clean, which also makes it so much easier to remove and store the patties. The press also has a convenient hole in the base allowing you to screw it down to a counter or work surface. Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: S. Tocker

customer_reviews.title: Hamburgers ready
customer_reviews.text: I like the way I can adjust the size of the hamburgers btw you can buy the wax sheets and stack and freeze them. A-Z easy to clean, however I will say this pay attention to the parts like the spring, and the adjustment screw when you clean it up! You don’t want to lose them
customer_reviews.author: Howie

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised. Is robust.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to form burgers for immediate cooking. It is wise to use plastic wrap on the bottom AND especially on the top to prevent meat from going behind the top plate. This will make clean up easy. It performs as advertised. Use a little more meat so that you have a little ooze out on the bottom that you trim; this ensures that you will have a perfect uniform sized patty. The diameter of the burger made is not large enough for me. I only wish that it had a larger diameter that would allow me to make "Whopper" or a "Fudruckers" size burger after cooking. I use 93% lean. Maybe a reader can help me?
customer_reviews.author: john b

customer_reviews.title: Cheap device, not like pictured
customer_reviews.text: I can't talk about how this works since I was so disappointed after taking it out of the box that I know it had to go back. First of all, handle is huge, not as pictured, making this item take up a lot of volume to store. Secondly, it does not have the patty measurements on the screw thread, so it is impossible to replicate size of patties which is the reason I wanted this. And on top of that, the item is lightweight and flimsy. I don't doubt it will work for patties, it is just not what I want or need.
customer_reviews.author: Karen in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget for making burger patties!
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands and making burger patties with the old device I have owned for years was getting next to impossible for me to use. I ordered this one and it is perfect. I can easily clean it plus it makes perfect sized patties in several thicknesses.
customer_reviews.author: bratzyone

customer_reviews.title: Comes with no instructions
customer_reviews.text: Like the fact that all my burgers and sausage patties are the same size . I put a plastic bag over the flat part on the bottom of the plate where you put the meat . When I am finished I pull off the bags and put in trash . Then my burger press stays clean. Love this item.
customer_reviews.author: margaret lowery

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, perfect patties every time
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy hamburger press that makes perfect patties for grilling every time. My dad had a similar one when I was younger, and it made me feel like a grill pro just like him. I definitely recommend the suggested wax squares for easy use and clean up.
customer_reviews.author: pcayers

customer_reviews.title: Helpful gadget but a pain to clean
customer_reviews.text: Do you *need* this? Probably not. Does it satisfy any obsessive need to have symmetry with your food? Yep. Losing two stars because it’s kinda a pain to clean. Would like to just put it in the dishwasher! I would say definitely use parchment because meat will otherwise stick to the plates, causing a mess.
customer_reviews.author: brittney

customer_reviews.title: eh
customer_reviews.text: This is a great concept, but it fails miserably. I used it a couple times and gave it to my sister who probably threw it in her basement or shoved it in a cupboard somewhere. I have a cheapo burger maker that I bought at the grocery store that works ten times better than this. I bought this because it is made really well, but functionally, the cheap plastic burger maker works better. With the cheapo, I dont have to use wax paper sheets, and the burger pops right out...this one, the burger stuck, you have to use wax paper or it sticks even more. Getting the thickness to be even is a pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Works great and makes great stuffed burgers!
customer_reviews.text: Works Great!! Put down a hamburger paper a ball of ground beef and another paper, close press and a great burger from n in hand with no mess. Have been using it to make stuffed burgers. Take ball of ground beef in a out you want for total burger, split it in two pieces, press 2 thinner patties, load desired filled in one patty lay 2nd patty on top and press again. Perfect stuffed burger.
customer_reviews.author: Bob R

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different burger press
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this one. My burgers fell apart as I was making them in the press. I put the hamburger meat in and pressed it down and when I hoped it the burgers was in a few pieces. I ended up just making them by hand since this press was useless.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie And Brad

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS S.O.B.!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this press! Easy to use and clean and this dude makes the best burgers! You can change the thickness of the burger by adjusting the press and the cleanup is easier than the plastic P.O.S. I used to use! I love that the metal press makes the burgers less crumbly. Buy this with the burger wax papers and you'll be a Pro in no time!
customer_reviews.author: Mark H.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why everyone raves about this...
customer_reviews.text: I like simplicity, and this product sure ain't that. It's NOT dishwasher safe, has to be disassembled into many little parts to properly clean. Honestly, I'm shifting back to hand-forming patties. Or check out the Cuisinart version of this, as it's much easier to clean (dishwasher safe too).
customer_reviews.author: ZestyKy

customer_reviews.title: A good simple burger press
customer_reviews.text: We have learned to rub down press surfaces which touch the ground beef, pork, turkey, or chicken with cooking oil to get an easy release. This press is easy to learn, to operate, and to clean. We have begun to use this press regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Cajun GourmetTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great Meat Press
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing hamburger in ready-made patties at the grocery store and only getting up to 12 pre-made patties with a total weight of 4lbs. I now purchase a 5lb roll of 80 20 lean meat and make 19 to 20 4oz patties for about the same price (give or take .40 cents). This was a money-saving item for me. It is very easy to use and I would purchase again. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Webster

customer_reviews.title: Great patty maker
customer_reviews.text: Works great and makes patties faster and more consistently than by hand. Definitely saves time. I wish it was dishwasher safe but being aluminum it's not, but it's easy enough to clean by hand after using and meat doesn't stick to it.
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad my husband purchased this because he was making the hamburgers very big and I could not eat one. But now he makes they with this and they come out perfect every time. They stay the same size after they are cooked as while
customer_reviews.author: Tom Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick work out of "Club Size" hamburger purchases.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my family tends to eat a lot of hamburgers, and I'm tired of hand-forming patties all the time. The pre-made patties at the store are usually made with crappy, cheap hamburger meat, so I buy the good stuff and make the patties at home, season them up, good stuff. I used a press like this 30 years or so ago as a teenager working in a restaurant, so it was a familiar experience getting used to it. Just make sure you also buy some of the "patty papers" to go with it so you can store them separately in the fridge or freezer.
customer_reviews.author: BKLKTX

customer_reviews.title: So easy
customer_reviews.text: Happy to have made this purchase. Using this gadget, we get uniform, seasoned burgers without having to buy the frozen Costco burgers. This gadget is so easy I’m going to put my 7 year old in charge of making the burgers next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jill H Sundstrom

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: Never used one this style. Its stout and way better than the last few i had. But does have a few more steps to clean... Have to unscrew the top and pull out the top piece. Would still reccomend works good once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The thing I dont like about certain places burgers is that they're too thick. I like the thickness of sonic or whataburger. Trying to mash the meat down to that size can be tricky and usually gets kind of broken up. This device allows me to get the perfect thickness without any breaks on the edges. It just makes the burgers look so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: One of the worst products I've ever purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Where to start? It looked good on the Amazon website but it's hard to use, hard to get the burger patties out (at least in one piece), hard to take apart, and almost impossible to clean thoroughly. I used it once and returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: macfearghuis

customer_reviews.title: I love the size of these patties it makes and thickness adjust-ability
customer_reviews.text: Simply to use. I suggest pre-measuring your meat on a scale, I liked 4 oz each and then rolled into a ball. I placed the ball between pre-cut wax paper sheets and backed off the adjustable screw by 1/2 turn. So easy and quick to pre-make a match of burgers that are all uniform in size. Makes for easier cooking, as they are all uniform. Place the sandwiched patties between wax paper sheets into the freezer for later. Frozen patties are easily separated and then cooked to taste.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D.

customer_reviews.title: appears well made
customer_reviews.text: works well for me. good if your gonna freeze about 5 lbs of burger or more. for a couple burgers , not worth cleaning. you gotta use wax papers or cling wrap to avoid sticking to machine. 5 lbs of burger, 20 burgers, 15 minutes. easy to disassemble and clean.I only used it once,replaced a plastic one I been useing for years. plastic one broke, this one aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Brower

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Performance
customer_reviews.text: It makes a nice patty once you get your technique down. 8 oz patties are a breeze and you're have a big party you can pump these out fast. I would suggest you get some 4 to 5 inch paper so you can stack them and they come out of the press easier.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Podany

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done - a good value
customer_reviews.text: This press does what it should; produces a uniform burger patty when operated properly. It is important to put the correct amount of meat into the press [it is adjustable] otherwise you may end up with something thinner on one side than the other. It takes some good amount of pressure, but that is to be expected with a light weight press. No sticking because I use burger paper on both top and bottom. Easy clean up because with the paper you don't "press" raw meat into the device. If you can live with a simple press then this could be just what you are looking for. Good value for cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Solid Burger Press
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several plastic burger presses that have all underwhelmed. This press is solid and you don’t feel as if making burgers will snap the press. The one downside is that it doesn’t automatically put a dimple in the burgers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be wider.
customer_reviews.text: The press works reasonably well. Anyone new to it would be well advised to put waxed paper on both sides of the meat to be compressed, otherwise despite its claim to be "non-stick" you'll be scraping meat from one plate or another. The only con I would say is that wish the press was wider. The burgers, when cooked on a Barbeque grill are more like sliders in sized than regular hamburgers. Even using the "dimple" trick they still shrink to slider size.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: It is really hard to clean and I have yet ...
customer_reviews.text: It is really hard to clean and I have yet to figure out how to use it without the meat getting stuck behind the press pad... Also, how do you use it to create injected patties with cheeses/onions? I dunno because I don't remember ever seeing it in the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Why make hamburger patties for free when you can pay more and have something else to clean up, too?
customer_reviews.text: There are reasons to use this, such as uniformity of patties and potentially more speed but for that it would've been better to get the double version. I still think this is just something else to clutter up your kitchen and the burgers we got out of it didn't change my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: You can not return this item even if your unsatisfied
customer_reviews.text: It mad hockey puck hamburgers and buyer be aware you can't return this!only thing on Amazon I've ever seen you can not return!
customer_reviews.author: tara l mizerak

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I like a thicker burger than the wife, no problem. Easy to use, I put a piece of paper under and on top of the meat and never had a paper tear. Push the button and pop, the burger releases from the top. Kinda wish I had gotten the double one now...
customer_reviews.author: Britt Spillman

customer_reviews.title: NOT RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: This press is typical of Chinese products. The adjustment screw threads on the top that allow for determining the thickness of the burger patty are “cast”, not machined and thus are so ratty that i wonder how much metal might be sheared and introduced into the meat. Further, the plate in the top that is moved by the ratty cast screw isn’t even close to parallel with the bottom base plate and cannot remotely come close to producing an even patty thickness. Cannot recommend this product. I’m returning it immediately without even trying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional product
customer_reviews.text: I don’t care five stars for most anything, this is been exactly as promised! This is sturdy, easy to use, makes the perfect hamburger patty that stays together on my grill. I would definitely recommend buying this.
customer_reviews.author: peanut 62

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Once I had the thing set for 1/3 burgers it pounded them out in quick fashion. I used wax paper top and bottom so clean up was just using alcohol on a paper towel to wipe off a little meat juice that seeped through the wax paper.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, but....
customer_reviews.text: This worked really well - ONCE - just once because I could never get it back together - because I could never get the thickness of the patties right again. Never again - it will probably end up at Goodwill. (Waaahhh)
customer_reviews.author: Susan K Troxell

customer_reviews.title: Nice burger press -- but use the squares!
customer_reviews.text: Handy little burger press, works just as it should. Haven't tried 'stuffed' burgers yet, but shouldn't be anything but delicious. I would highly recommend buying (or making your own) waxed-paper squares for use with this, or any, burger press.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Havemann

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST BURGER MAKER FULLY ADJUSTABLE
customer_reviews.text: I was vasolating between a plastic model (less $) and this fully adjustable metal unit, I decided to "bite da bullet" and purchase an all metal unit. I know it's more money, however, I don't have to worry about being able to clean this all metal unit compared to plastic plus it's fully adjustable! I whole heartily recommend this Weston burger maker!!
customer_reviews.author: Devil Man

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this press dont wast your money
customer_reviews.text: My first burger press and was a very bad choice. I used it one time then cleaned it and put it away. When I used it the next time I noticed that the coating on the burger press was peeling off and could potentially stick to the meat so therefore I threw it away. I was very disappointed but do look forward to purchasing a different burger press
customer_reviews.author: KRYSTA L. MITCHELL

customer_reviews.title: Burger press
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice burger press. It comes apart easy enough for cleaning and gives user a wide range of thickness options unlike the plastic patty presses ive used in the past. I used a sheet of parchment paper on the bottom and peeled the patty off of the top while pressing the plunger. For a family party i was able to prepare around 40 burgers in under an hour. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F

product_meta.title: Weston Burger Express Hamburger Press With Patty Ejector , Makes 4 1/2" Patties, 1/4Lb To 3/4Lb
product_meta.description: Style Name:Single With Patty EjectorExclusive spring plunger makes patty pressing & removal effortless. Also great for making stuffed burgers, crab cakes & Sausage patties. Spring plunger for easy patty removal. Adjustable patty thickness from ¼" to 1 ¼". Patties measure 4 ½" in diameter. Nonstick coating. Cast aluminum. Wipes clean.
feature_bullets: Press your favorite ground meat & seasonings into consistent, perfectly packed burgers
Spring plunger button compacts the patty tightly then pops back for quick patty removal
Also great for making stuffed burgers, crab cakes & sausage patties
Great for beef, venison, and other wild game
Make consistent burgers that cook evenly and don't fall apart on the grill
Adjustable patty thickness from 1/4 inch to 1 1/2 inches
Patties measure 4 ½ inches in diameter
Adjustable patty weight from ¼ pounds to ¾ pounds
Non stick coating for quick and easy clean up

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,582 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
